name: Biochar System (Icons Only)
description: Biochar flow diagram using only SVG icons without backgrounds

tooltip.title: Chicken House
tooltip.description: Primary poultry production facility where chickens are raised and litter is generated

details.description: Modern chicken house with climate control and automated feeding systems. Generates both live chickens for processing and used poultry litter for biochar conversion.

tooltip.title: Processing Plant
tooltip.description: Poultry processing facility that converts live chickens into meat products

details.description: USDA-certified processing plant with waste segregation systems. Produces chicken meat products while generating organic waste streams for biogas production.

tooltip.title: Pyrolysis Unit
tooltip.description: Thermal conversion system that transforms litter into biochar, syngas, and bio-oils

details.description: Advanced pyrolysis reactor operating at 500-700°C in oxygen-limited environment. Converts organic waste into stable biochar while capturing valuable energy products.

tooltip.title: Anaerobic Digester
tooltip.description: Biogas production system that processes organic waste into renewable energy

details.description: Mesophilic anaerobic digestion system enhanced with biochar additives for improved efficiency. Processes organic waste streams while generating renewable biogas.

tooltip.title: Biochar Output
tooltip.description: Stable carbon product used as soil amendment and livestock additive

details.description: High-quality biochar with enhanced properties for agricultural and livestock applications. Carbon-negative product that improves soil health and reduces emissions.

tooltip.title: Syngas Energy
tooltip.description: Renewable fuel gas produced during pyrolysis, used for process heat

details.description: Clean-burning synthesis gas (syngas) composed primarily of hydrogen, carbon monoxide, and methane. Used to provide process heat for digestion and other operations.

tooltip.title: Live Chicken Transport
tooltip.description: Transfer of market-ready chickens to processing facility

details.description: Live chickens transported from house to processing plant at optimal weight (2.5-3 kg per bird). Transport uses climate-controlled vehicles to ensure animal welfare.

tooltip.title: Used Litter Transport
tooltip.description: Collection of spent bedding material containing manure for biochar conversion

details.description: Used poultry litter consisting of pine shavings mixed with chicken manure and feathers. Collected after each growth cycle and transported to pyrolysis unit.

tooltip.title: Offal Waste Stream
tooltip.description: Non-meat organic waste from poultry processing

details.description: Offal waste including organs, blood, feathers, and other organic materials removed during processing. High-energy substrate ideal for biogas production.

tooltip.title: Biochar Production
tooltip.description: Primary stable carbon product from pyrolysis process

details.description: High-quality biochar product with porous structure and high carbon content. Ready for agricultural applications or further processing into livestock feed additives.

tooltip.title: Syngas Generation
tooltip.description: Renewable fuel gas produced as byproduct of pyrolysis

details.description: Clean-burning syngas captured from pyrolysis vapors. Provides renewable energy for digester heating and other process requirements.

tooltip.title: Biochar Addition
tooltip.description: Biochar additive to enhance digestion efficiency

details.description: Finely ground biochar added to anaerobic digester to improve microbial activity and biogas production. Provides surface area for beneficial bacteria and buffers pH.

tooltip.title: Process Heat
tooltip.description: Thermal energy from syngas combustion for digester temperature control

details.description: Heat generated from syngas combustion maintains optimal mesophilic temperature (35-40°C) in anaerobic digester. Ensures consistent biogas production year-round.
